name: Imperial Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have lived in Great Yarmouth over 10 yrs and are last minute trippers who just like to get up and go, because of this we have stayed in so many hotels in many different locations all over the UK some fantastic and others not so (to be polite), but this hotel will have definatly inbedded an impression in our memorys, that will never be forgotten. On 8th September 2012 we tied the knot (finally).lol. We had the ceremony, breakfast and party all at the Imperial hotel. To start with the staff was so friendly and welcoming, the hotel owners could not do enough to make the day go as smoothly as possibly, the food was quite frankly amaizing, really fresh produce and with over 100 guests to our wedding though out the day, they constantly commented how beautiful the food was, not one could find fault. Te rooms put aside for the venues were more than capable to cater for our requirments, without intruding on other guest staying at the hotel, the residents bar open for as long as we wanted so even after the party guest had long left we could still enjoy a quite drink well in to the early hours. There is also a lift so push chairs or guest under the influence.. dont have to stuggle.lol
reviews.title: Quite frankly Wow, A hidden gem on Norfolks Coastline.

reviews.text: Our room was large, with wifi and many ammeinities catered for and immaculatly clean, we also checked on some of our guests who stayed with us and there rooms were also immaculate, but varied in size depending on the occupants needs. I wake up every morning open my bedroom curtains and stare straight out to sea, but somehow doing the same in this hotel just made me feel a million miles away. We all has high expectations for breakfast, after the meals from the day before, and it didn't dissapoint. Three courses, each with multiple selections was more than we wished for, and all served to us, rather than a mad dash around and yes truly delicious.
reviews.title: Communication problems with reception and cleaning staff Don't bother putting your sign do not disturb on the door as no notice

reviews.text: Nice and clean nothing special . Room service menu is rubbish . Burger with ten chips , salad with no carbs , no veg offered . No side dishes ,No starters or extras . Does not live up to the name . Monday night no sleep football on the pitch behind the hotel . Loud speakers playing music till late and people shouting Will never go again . Nothing imperial at all . I wish I had more to talk about . Nothing special .
reviews.title: The best food in Great Yarmouth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During a visit to Great Yarmouth I was lucky enough to eat two nights in a row at The Imperial. The first night was spent at Cafe Cru, where we experienced exceptional service and delicious food. I chose the asparagus risotto followed by the peanut and honeycomb cheesecake, and was not disappointed! The atmosphere was relaxing and the staff very friendly. The next night we ate at The Terrace, the newest part of the hotel. The view of the sea was fantastic, and the lasagna I decided on was the perfect choice. Again the staff were kind and helpful, we couldn't have asked for a better evening. Thank you very much to everyone who catered for us - I will definitely be coming again as soon as possible!
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.text: stayed for a night in july. on arrival made to feel very welcome. location is good as it overlooks the beach but is a 10 min walk away from the main strip so its nice and quiet. foyer very nice so good 1st impression. room was average size, and exceptionally clean, as was the bathroom. generous amounts of complimentary tea/coffee etc. bed slightly soft. we had requested extra pillows on booking which were in or room. breakfast was fantastic, with a great selection of all breakfast items as well as cooked full english. breakfast is waitress serviced. we ate in the downstairs restaurant (booking recommended as it is very popular). It was advertized as award-winning and it was clear why. the food was amazing, and despite being very busy the service was good and staff friendly and helpful. will definitely book again if we find ourselves in the area. well worth a visit!
reviews.title: Fantastic....
Brilliant food, brilliant staff.
reviews.text: I was here with 4 friends of mine and we thoroughly enjoyed the food. Not only that, the staff were very friendly and approachable, catering to our needs.

I was here on business holding focus groups and stayed the night. What stood out for me was the genuinely friendly service from all the staff - reception, waitresses and the owner Nick. I didn't know Nick was the owner until I was leaving but he couldn't have done more to help me with a video camera that I was struggling to get to work. The food in the Terrace restaurant was lovely and there was a good choice at breakfast including freshly squeezed orange juice. The room was fine with an excellent wi-fi connection. I have already recommended the hotel to one of my colleagues.
reviews.title: They go the extra mile

reviews.text: Very cosy Hotel located at the beach front in Great Yarmouth. The hotel might be old, but the room I had was clean and nice. Bathroom seems to be newly refurbished. The staff makes you feel very welcommed. I had fish and chips in the restaurant and that was one of the best I ever had. Fresh fish and large home made chips...and vinegar on the table. I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice beach front Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good service and very friendly staff. Book early if you want a sea view room.
reviews.title: Home From Home

reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure to stay at the Imperial Hotel for three nights. We both agreed that the stay was like we had been welcomed into Nick and Aillens own home. All the staff could not do more to make us feel welcomed with so much concern that all was ok with our stay that we felt our Mums were there with us. In this day and age these priniciples have long been lost and we were both sad to leave especially when one of the staff were waving us goodbye as we drove by. I would recommend this hotel any time. Especially when on top of the service received the top class food served in the The Terrace or Cafe Cru which is to die for. We will be back we have no doubt we cant wait.
reviews.title: good hotel with excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We attended a dinner for about 150 people. There were only 2 staff on the bar although the hotel knew 150 people would want a drink in the half hour preceding the meal! 4 star service? I think not. The worst part though was the wine list with the meal. It was all extremely cheap nasty wine, at very high prices. I gambled on the Argentine Malbec at £26.50 but it was so awful I couldn't even drink it and gave it away to another table. Our friends are not wine snobs but even they couldn't drink the various whites they tried, and even resorted to sneaking a few bottles in from a neighbouring hotel! We had to spend £75 on a Laurent Perrier Rose as it was the only drinkable wine on the list, even the Prosecco was so bad our friends left it. 4 star hotels shouldn't be resorting to doing things on the cheap. Bar and waiting staff were friendly though despite being under pressure from lack of numbers. I have stayed here previously and it's a decent hotel overall but make sure you go out for a meal - preferably to a nearby restaurant called Carlo's which is fantastic! (booking essential)
reviews.title: poor service - terrible wine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only booked three days in advance but was pleasantly agreeable to be given a seaview room with balcony for a three day leisure break. The Imperial is an ideal hotel in which to relax and big thanks to ALL the staff for making this so. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the promenade and sea was the most enjoyable start to the day, whilst the evening meal nicely rounded off the day.
reviews.title: If you want a hotel to relax, the Imperial is the one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 2 night break and it was a nice hotel, staff friendly we did have to wait a fraction after 2'oclock for our room but we had been upgraded to a seaview so a few extra minutes didn't matter. The room was one on the 5th floor with a balcony which was really nice but boy was it hot even with the window and door open and a fan on it was boiling. Neither of us got a really good nights sleep because even though it was a nice comfy bed the heat in the room was not good needed air conditioning!. The breakfast was good but didn't like the fact the waiters/waitresses put your sauce on and that if you are an avid coffee drinker like me you had to keep asking for more. We did not eat in the hotel as it seemed far too expensive I am not sure if a lot of people did but would have thought if they wanted more people to dine it would be good to have a set menu at a reasonable fixed price. Would recommend it as it was a nice hotel but not the balcony rooms
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Our 4 nights at the Imperial were a Mother's Day treat for my elderly mum. Our room, a sea facing executive room , was spacious, comfortable and immaculately clean. The public rooms were relaxing with plenty of comfortable seating - ideal for watching the world go by. The reception staff were efficient and friendly as, indeed, were all the other staff with whom we came in contact - waiters, chambermaids etc. The leisure facilities are good although I fail to understand why hotel guests are not allowed to use the changing facilities here. Breakfast was excellent and the service was efficient although the restaurant was very busy at times. The one dinner which we took at the hotel was not particularly memorable - the beef was tough and the food was not piping hot. I look forward to returning to the Imperial - but will probably choose to eat dinner elsewhere.
reviews.title: Pefect for unwiding and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at The Imperial, for two nights commencing 9/5/2011.
reviews.title: Lovely short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We heard that Great Yarmouth has been "redone" along the seafront and decided to see for ourselves. We stayed at the Imperial, which is the only four star awarded hotel, in Great Yarmouth. They have spent a fortune with their new frontage including their cafe, which overlooks the sea across the road. This cafe is very modern and a delight to sit and take in the sea air and see what is going on. Our room, costing £117.00 for bead and breakfast was a nice size with all the amentities associated with a four star hotel and I believe that this was a fair price. The old fashioned lift was more out of use than in use, during our stay which was frustrating, as I have trouble walking and had to use the stairs (2 flights). I have to stay that though their cafe cruz is a delight with their view, the service is very slow with the waitress getting my order wrong! and then not offering a finger bowl or another serviette for the unpeeled prawns that I had, I am giving them four stars overall and not five. Get your lift sorted and the customer service in your restaurant and I am sure that all your patrons, will be giving you 5 stars every time.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Imperial Hotel 3 times the last time was last weekend. Great breakfast, staff very helpfull, rooms lovey. We had a evening meal in the Cafe Cruz - amazing food. Great hotel. Would recommed this hotel.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: Just back from an early lunch at The Terrace at the Imperial Hotel. What a great place - super setting looking out to sea (just pretend the car park in front doesn't exist), in the sunshine, watching the holidaymakers and enjoying a lovely lunch served by charming and efficient staff. We had previously eaten at The Cafe Cruz (very very good) in the hotel and were delighted with this new addition.
reviews.title: Great Yarmouth - Great Imperial Terrace
Highly Recommended!
reviews.text: Hats off to this family run hotel.
My early memories of Yarmouth are from staying on the caravan site past the Iron Duke (now closed) and walking up to the Pleasure Beach and having roast Sunday lunch on Regent Road.
reviews.title: I thoroughly recommend
Excellent wine list
reviews.text: You may not like everything in this hotel (e.g. the bath room and in particular the shower) but you cannot fault it for the wine list as another guest did. The house wines include excellent bottles from all over the world at a reasonable price and if you cannot find anything you fancy, there is a large list of other wines, red-white-rosé. It is particularly pleasant to drink a glass in the verandah overlooking the bay rather than in the dining room, too dark for my liking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very pleasant hotel to which I would return. Re the bathroom, I do not like these "rainshowers" if there is not another shower next to it and I will never understand why hotel owners do not provide a soap holder. I also regreted the absence of a shaving mirror, a mixer tap and shelves above the lavabo but these are minor complaints.
reviews.title: Nice restful break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner was right to reply vigorously to the assertion that the "wines are cheap and nasty" - the contrary is true and in my many travels to the UK I have rarely found a better list.
reviews.title: One of our favourites for a regular visit

reviews.text: We have just spent 4 enjoyable days at the Imperial Hotel. Welcome was good, room was great with a view from a balcony across the bay. Food was pleasant and we usually had our meals on the terrace overlooking the sea. Just wonderful. We hope to go again.
reviews.title: Great service with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions and it maintains its place on our "must visit again" list. On this occasion, when we arrived late morning we were surprised that our sea-view room was already available. As we were settling in, a knock on the door heralded delivery of chocolates and champagne - a benefit we had overlooked when we booked the champagne option - we thought it was just the name of the package.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel with wonderful staff who gave impeccable service

reviews.text: Three of us stayed here recently, in 2 rooms, on a Saturday night. Reception was quick and efficient, our rooms were very good (for a seaside hotel) – they have been recently decorated, but the wallpaper is a bit 90’s. Good showers.
reviews.title: Don't Hesitate
Absolutely Superb
reviews.text: We had dinner in Café Cruz. It was pretty much without fault we enjoyed great food and great service (despite it being busy).
We had really excellent steaks, the only downside was the chips, which looked like the dregs from the local chippy. If they were home cut and double fried the meal would have been perfect.
reviews.title: Familiarity Doesn't Breed Contempt....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall though I am loathed to criticise the place. If every restaurant in the UK was half as good as this place you wouldn't need to check TA for restaurant reviews, as a good meal every time would be guaranteed!
reviews.title: Fablous overnighter

reviews.text: If I ever found myself in Great Yarmouth again I would not hesitate to stay here.
reviews.title: Fabulous food and service to match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in many hotels, we rate the Imperial very highly. The reception area staff were top class (Gill and Sara dealt with our queries) as was Pat in the bar area and David the restaurant manager who helped with my gluten free food. The views, rooms & facilities (inc the gym) were excellent.
reviews.title: Great Stay - Would Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chris Beale.
reviews.title: Elegant victorian hotel well presented.

reviews.text: The hotel is situated right on the sea front and from the outside looks well maintained and not faded splendor as some of the seafront hotels appear. The staff were very efficient, friendly and helpful with parking advice. The room was on the top floor with a great view and was spotless with the biggest bathroom of any hotel I have stayed in. However there was one small problem that blighted what was an otherwise excellent stay, and this was the room ventilation, or lack of it !.
reviews.title: Well done Imperial most impressed

reviews.text: The room was stifflingly hot when we first went in to it, so we opened the window, which we closed within minutes as the wind buffeting the building was continually rattling all the doors, to such a degree that it sounded like someone constantly banging the doors open and shut. even with the window in eithe the bathroom or bedroom open just a small amount and the curtains closed the noise was really bad, so we had to suffer one of the hottest nights I have had outside the tropics.
reviews.title: The restaurant is fantastic - delicious meals and excellent service

reviews.text: This is a real shame as the rest of the stay including useing the swimming pool was first class. Not sure if I was just unlucky with the room or if others have complained of the same problem. I would be interested to hear other experiences.
reviews.title: 2 night break

reviews.text: Rooms 301 and 505. Excellent rooms, recently decorated. We spent 2 nights at the hotel. First night we experienced the Evening Meal which comprised of Nouvelle Cuisine (as we expected - little substance but looks nice). 2 courses were included in the Sunday by the Sea tarriff. If you like quantity I'd go somewhere else to eat and the extras (a liqueur coffee was 7 quid) were expensive. Monday night we went to Romeo's Italian Restaurant in the town which was far more enjoyable and better value for money.
reviews.title: Uncomfortably hot rooms at night

reviews.text: Staff were very helpful and courteous. Not sure why but both nights both rooms had to sleep with the windows wide open as the heat was overwhelming in both rooms which affected the quality of my sleep. Saying that, I'd gladly recommend this hotel to anyone and I've been many times since a work residential here in the early 90s. Love the pool and especially the jaccuzzi.
reviews.title: excellent treat you like royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had my mum and dads golden aniversary here and always buy mum and dad gift vouchers at every opertunity.weldone and keep up the good work.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on a spring offer to celebrate our birthdays. We asked for a balcony room and were delighted on check in to be allocated a sea view balcony room, with a wonderful view of the promenade and the pier.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: There was plenty of parking at the rear of the hotel, which was covered by the hotels CCTV. The leisure area, pool, sauna and steam room was lovely. We had afternoon tea, breakfast and lunch in the terrace area. No complaints about the food or the service, and the outlook from this area is exceptional.
reviews.title: Customer Service

description: The Imperial Hotel is Great Yarmouth's only 4 Star hotel. We are an independent hotel managed by the 3rd generation of the family that have owned this hotel since the 1930s. We have stunning seaviews and provide an excellent location for both the business and leisure traveller and can assure you of a warm professional welcome.
